Package com.github.yellowstonegames.core

Class ColorGradients

java.lang.Object
com.github.yellowstonegames.core.ColorGradients
public final class ColorGradients extends Object
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of IntLists. The intent is for the IntList to be used as a sequence of packed int Oklab colors. You can create a new IntList gradient with makeGradient(int, int, int, InterpolationFunction), but any IntList will work (although it only makes sense if it contains packed Oklab colors or is empty). Once you have a IntList, you can pass it to appendGradient(IntList, int, int, int, InterpolationFunction) to make a gradient between two colors, or appendGradientChain(IntList, int, InterpolationFunction, int...) to make a gradient between more than two colors. You can also customize each section between colors with appendPartialGradient(IntList, int, int, int, InterpolationFunction), which is just like appendGradient() but doesn't add the end color (since it is the start color of the next partial gradient, until you finally end by appending just the end). Using appendPartialGradient(), you can have each transition use a different number of steps.

  • Method Details

    • makeGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList makeGradient(int start, int end, int steps)
      Creates a IntList gradient from the packed int Oklab color start to the packed int Oklab color end, taking the specified number of steps and using linear interpolation. This limits individual steps of color to the correct Oklab gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2, and must be non-negative
      Returns:
      a new IntList that contains the requested gradient

    • makeGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList makeGradient(int start, int end, int steps, Interpolations.InterpolationFunction interpolation)
      Creates a IntList gradient from the packed int Oklab color start to the packed int Oklab color end, taking the specified number of steps and using the specified Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct Oklab gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2, and must be non-negative
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      Returns:
      a new IntList that contains the requested gradient

    • appendGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradient(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int start, int end, int steps)
      Appends a gradient from the packed int Oklab color start to the packed int Oklab color end, taking the specified number of steps and using linear Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct Oklab gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradient(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int start, int end, int steps, Interpolations.InterpolationFunction interpolation)
      Appends a gradient from the packed int Oklab color start to the packed int Oklab color end, taking the specified number of steps and using the specified Interpolation for how it transitions. This limits individual steps of color to the correct Oklab gamut, so even interpolations between colors at extreme points in the color space will stay in-gamut.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end on
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradientChain(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int steps, int... chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed int Oklab colors provided in chain. This uses linear Interpolation for the whole gradient. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      chain - an array or varargs of packed int Oklab colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradientChain(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int steps, com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed int Oklab colors provided in chain. This uses linear Interpolation for the whole gradient. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      chain - a IntList of packed int Oklab colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradientChain(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int steps, Interpolations.InterpolationFunction interpolation, com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed int Oklab colors provided in chain. This uses the specified Interpolation for the whole gradient, which can make some colors use smaller sections than others. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      chain - a IntList of packed int Oklab colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendGradientChain

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendGradientChain(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int steps, Interpolations.InterpolationFunction interpolation, int... chain)
      Appends a gradient between several packed int Oklab colors provided in chain. This uses the specified Interpolation for the whole gradient, which can make some colors use smaller sections than others. Appends to the end of appending and produces a total of steps colors.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions to end
      chain - an array or varargs of packed int Oklab colors that this will interpolate through in order
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to the end

    • appendPartialGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendPartialGradient(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int start, int end, int steps)
      Exactly like appendGradient(IntList, int, int, int), but does not include end in what it appends to appending. This is intended for the implementation of chained gradients, where the end of a previous gradient becomes the start of the next one. This still uses the specified number of steps, it just doesn't append end in the last step.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end just before
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to its end

    • appendPartialGradient

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appendPartialGradient(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList appending, int start, int end, int steps, Interpolations.InterpolationFunction interpolation)
      Exactly like appendGradient(IntList, int, int, int, InterpolationFunction), but does not include end in what it appends to appending. This is intended for the implementation of chained gradients, where the end of a previous gradient becomes the start of the next one. This still uses the specified number of steps, it just doesn't append end in the last step.
      Parameters:
      appending - a IntList that will be appended to
      start - the packed int Oklab color to start with
      end - the packed int Oklab color to end just before
      steps - how many steps the gradient should use; usually greater than 2
      interpolation - a libGDX Interpolation that can be used to customize how start transitions toward end
      Returns:
      appending, after adding the gradient to its end

    • toRGBA8888

      public static com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList toRGBA8888(com.github.tommyettinger.ds.IntList colors)
      Given an IntList of packed int Oklab colors (the kind the rest of this class produces), this edits that IntList so each color is converted to RGBA format (the kind typically displayed on-screen). This is useful as a last step before the gradient is complete, since assembling a gradient works better (and looks smoother) in Oklab space.
      Parameters:
      colors - an IntList of packed int Oklab colors, as produced by the rest of this class
      Returns:
      colors, after it has had each item changed to use RGBA format
